topic.title: Assigning Values to Data Sets in MODFLOW and SUTRA

para.text: Assigning Values to Data Sets in MODFLOW and SUTRA
ModelMuse assigns values to data sets at cells in MODFLOW or to elements and nodes in SUTRA models using the following procedure.

list.style: text-indent:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-left:0px; tabstops:none; font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

li.text: First, a default value is assigned to every node or element by using either the selected interpolation method (see "
"), or the default formula for the data set (See "

Next, each object that affects the data set is processed, and nodes or elements that are intersected or enclosed by each object are assigned values by using the object’s formula for the data set. Each object replaces values assigned previously by the default formula or by a previous object.

para.text: In MODFLOW and SUTRA, 2-D data sets are typically used to define the upper and lower surfaces of grid or mesh layers rather than for defining objects that cross layer boundaries.
